Subjective: Left ear pain, fullness, decreased hearing. Feels like water in ear. Gradual onset 2-3 days ago. Worse after showering. Pain 3-4/10 daily, 6-7/10 after showering. Unable to swim due to pain. Cleans ear with cotton buds 3x/week. No fever. No other illness. Pain manageable. Worried about hearing loss. Request: Look in ear, improve hearing, relieve pain.
Objective: Vitals: Temp 36.2 C. Right ear: Normal canal, normal tympanic membrane. Left ear: Canal red, inflamed, swollen, thick. Tympanic membrane not well visualized. Pain on traction.
Assessment: Otitis externa, left ear. Likely secondary to moisture exposure and cotton bud use. No signs of otitis media.
Plan: 1. Pain management: Paracetamol up to 4000mg/day PRN. 2. Ear drops: Anti-inflammatory, acidic drops (e.g., Ciprofloxacin/Dexamethasone otic suspension) 3 drops TID x 1 week. 3. Hygiene: Avoid cotton buds. Keep ear dry for 1 week. 4. Follow-up: Return in 1 week for re-evaluation. 5. Safety netting: Return sooner if pain worsens significantly, discharge increases, or fever develops.
